title: Jose Mourinho rates Man Utd's chances against Liverpool and reacts to Mohamed Salah's absence
text:
Jose Mourinho is hopeful that Manchester United can beat Liverpool at Old Trafford (Picture: Getty)

Jose Mourinho believes Manchester United have a ‘great chance’ of getting over their recent struggles and beating Liverpool, especially considering Jurgen Klopp is without Mohamed Salah at Old Trafford.

The Red Devils have had a wretched start to the season, winning just two of their eight opening matches in the Premier League, while Liverpool are five points clear at the top of the table with a 100 per cent record.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer will be desperate for a morale-boosting victory on Sunday afternoon, with United reportedly ‘concrete’ in talks with former Juventus boss Massimiliano Allegri.

Though Liverpool are heavy favourites heading into the clash, both Mourinho and Roy Keane were optimistic over United’s hopes in the Sky Sports studio ahead of kick-off.

United have won just two league games under Solskjaer this term (Picture: Getty)

‘Everyone expects Liverpool top of the league to come here and win, I’m not so sure,’ Mourinho said.

‘I think United has a great chance to change the feelings.

‘This game means a lot for the fans, and in the dressing room, you know that.

‘You feel that, you breathe that, and you know that for sure as a player.’

Roy Keane added: ‘You just hope there’s some sort of reaction from United. There has to be.

‘You’ve got to turn it into war today.

‘There might be a twist today, you never know

Salah misses out after sustaining an ankle injury (Picture: Getty)

Mohamed Salah will play no part at Old Trafford after picking up an ankle injury and Mourinho believes the Egyptian’s absence could have a significant impact.

On Salah missing out, Mourinho said: ‘The fact that Salah doesn’t play think makes a huge difference.

‘The last time I remember Salah playing against a back three with a great impact was against Roma in the Champions League.

‘Liverpool, Salah and Mane in between the positions, they killed Roma.’
